Engine.​src.​logic.​behavior.​SolidBody
Engine.​src.​logic.​Behavior
public
Engine.​src.​logic.​behavior.​SolidBody
Engine.​src.​logic.​behavior.​SolidMass

Behavior of an object that blocks ans is blocked by other solids.  It has a friction coefficient and a bounciness.

Constants
DefaultFrictionCoefficient
protected const double DefaultFrictionCoefficient
DefaultBounciness
protected const double DefaultBounciness
Variables
Friction
public float Friction
Bounciness
public float Bounciness
Functions
SolidBody
public SolidBody()

Instanciates a default SolidBody behaviour.

The friction coefficient is by default set to 0.4 .

The bounciness coefficient, multiplied to the speed when bouncing, is by default set to 0 .

SolidBody
public SolidBody(
float frictionCoefficient,
float bounciness
)

Instanciates a SolidBody behaviour

Parameters
frictionCoefficient
float

(default = 0.4)

bounciness
float

Multiplied to the speed when bouncing (default = 0)

Enter
public override void Enter(
GameObject gameObject1,
Collider coll1,
GameObject gameObject2,
Collider coll2
)

Called when gameObject1's collider coll1 enters gameObject2's collider coll2.

If both are solid, it will move coll1 outside of coll2.

Parameters
gameObject1
GameObject
coll1
Collider

gameObject1's collider in contact with coll2

gameObject2
GameObject
coll2
Collider

gameObject2's collider in contact with coll1

GetCircleCircleDepth
public float GetCircleCircleDepth(
Circle circle1,
Circle circle2,
Vector2 speed,
Side collisionSide
)

Determines the depth of a circle1 inside circle2

Does not take the speed nor the collisionSide into account, the depth is calculated along the rays

Parameter
speed
Vector2

Speed of circle1 when it enters circle2

collisionSide

GetCircleCircleCollisionSide
public Side GetCircleCircleCollisionSide(
Circle circle1,
Circle circle2,
Vector2 speed,
bool isInside
)

Calculates the collision side of circle1 and circle2

If circle1 is completly inside circle2, the side is set as the tangent to circle2 at the entry point (calculated with speed).

If circle1 is partially inside circle2, the side is set as the side between the two intersection points.

Parameters
circle1
Circle

Moving circle

circle2
Circle

Reference circle

speed
Vector2

circle1's speed

isInside
bool

Must be true if circle1 is inside circle2

GetCirclePolygonCollisionSide
public Side GetCirclePolygonCollisionSide(
Circle circle,
Polygon polygon,
Vector2 speed,
bool isInside
)

Calculates the collision side of circle and polygon

If circle is completly inside polygon, the side is set as the polygon's side that contains the entry point of circle (calculated with speed)

If circle is partially inside polygon, the side is set as the polygon's side that is the opposed the most to speed.  See ChooseCollisionSide(Polygon, List{Side}, Vector2) for more details.

Parameters
circle
Circle

Moving circle

polygon
Polygon

Reference polygon

speed
Vector2

circle's speed

isInside
bool

Must be true if circle is inside polygon

GetPolygonCircleCollisionSide
public Side GetPolygonCircleCollisionSide(
Polygon polygon,
Circle circle,
Vector2 speed,
bool isInside
)

Calculates the collision side of polygon and circle

If polygon is completly inside circle, the side is set as the tangent to circle to the entry point of the deepest point of the polygon (calculated with speed)

If polygon is partially inside circle, the side is build from the two intersection points.  See Circle.GetIntersectionPoints(Polygon) for more details.

Parameters
polygon
Polygon

Moving polygon

circle
Circle

Reference circle

speed
Vector2

polygon's speed

isInside
bool

Must be true if polygon is inside circle

GetPolygonPolygonCollisionSide
public Side GetPolygonPolygonCollisionSide(
Polygon polygon1,
Polygon polygon2,
Vector2 speed,
bool isInside
)

Calculates the collision side of polygon1 and polygon2

If polygon1 is completly inside polygon2, the side is set as the tangent to polygon1 to the entry point of the deepest point of the polygon2 (calculated with speed)

If polygon1 is partially inside polygon2, the side is build from the two intersection points.  See ChooseCollisionSide(Polygon, List{Side}, Vector2) for more details.

Parameters
polygon1
Polygon
polygon2
Polygon
speed
Vector2
isInside
bool
ChooseCollisionSide
public Side ChooseCollisionSide(
Circle circle,
List<Side> sides,
Vector2 speed
)

Returns the side with a normal vector the closest as the inverted speed, and with the greatest contact length possible with circle

Parameters

Moving circle

sides
List<Side>

List of sides to choose from

speed

Returns

Null if sides is empty
